pullRequest.title: [modbus][sunspec] full inverter support
pullRequest.bodyText:
This pull request is the follow up of PR #6331, this is the complete support for single phase inverters as well support for two and three phase inverters. This is the 3rd of the 4 PR I've split my original PR into.
While it seems to be large at first, it does not change any of the main logic, just extends the parser and handler with the remaining fields of the incoming data. Also adds support for two and three phase inverters, but they are technically the same as the single phase inverter, only that have more channels than the single phase ones.

commit.message:
[sunspec] Support for inverter dc side readout

This commit increases the amount if data read out from inverters by
adding support for the DC side values (current, voltage, power)

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

[sunspec] support for default AC phase data

This commit adds support for the default AC phase information readout

This must be supported by all types of invertes.

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

[sunspec] Support for two and three phase inverters

Two and tree phase inverter description differs from single phase inverters
only by having multiple ac phase descriptor groups. All these fields are optional
because they share the same descriptor block with the single phase inverter
type.

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

nodes.bodyText: Any reason scaleFactor couldn't be primitive?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -507,6 +507,20 @@ protected State getScaled(Optional<? extends Number> value, Optional<Short> scal
         return getScaled(value.get().longValue(), scaleFactor.get(), unit);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Returns value multiplied by the 10 on the power of scaleFactory
+     *
+     * @param value the value to alter
+     * @param scaleFactor the scale factor to use (may be negative)
+     * @return the scaled value as a DecimalType
+     */
+    protected State getScaled(Optional<? extends Number> value, Short scaleFactor, Unit<?> unit) {

@@ -45,6 +65,26 @@
 		<state readOnly="true" pattern="%d %unit%"/>
 	</channel-type>
 	
+	<channel-type id="dc-current-type">
+		<item-type>Number:ElectricCurrent</item-type>
+		<label>DC Current Value</label>
+		<state readOnly="true" pattern="%.1f %unit%"/>
+	</channel-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="dc-voltage-type">
+		<item-type>Number:ElectricPotential</item-type>
+		<label>DC Voltage Value</label>
+		<state readOnly="true" pattern="%d %unit%"/>
+	</channel-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="dc-power-type">
+		<item-type>Number:Power</item-type>
+		<label>DC Power Value</label>
+		<state readOnly="true" pattern="%d %unit%"/>
+	</channel-type>
+
+
+

nodes.bodyText: These should be using your channelUID(...) method in instead.
Does this need to be a map? I don't see you using the map keys, is that for a future PR?

commit.message:
[sunspec] using channelUID method

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

nodes.bodyText: Is that the naming used by the protocol specification? Otherwise I would prefer L1, L2, L3, which is the common naming.
